'''Ioreth''' was a woman of [[Gondor]] during the [[War of the Ring]]. 

==History==
Ioreth was originally from [[Imloth Melui]] in [[Lossarnach]], but moved to [[Minas Tirith]] and worked in the [[Houses of Healing]]. By {{TA|3019}} she was the oldest woman working there and was well versed in old lore. Upon seeing the illness-stricken [[Faramir]], she said that she wished there was still a king in Gondor, remarking "For it is said in old lore: ''The hands of the king are the hands of a healer''." [[Gandalf]] heard this, and brought [[Aragorn]] to the Houses of Healing, where he was able to heal many of the sick. Ioreth was very talkative, which annoyed Aragorn and Gandalf.<ref>{{RK|Houses}}</ref>

==Etymology==
''Ioreth'' means "old woman" in [[Sindarin]]; ''[[iaur]]'' ("old") plus feminine ending ''[[-eth]]''. In draft, Tolkien had spelt her name ''Yoreth''.<ref name=Joukes>[[J.R.R. Tolkien]], "[[Letter to Mr Joukes|Letter to a Mr. Joukes dated August 28, 1967]]", published in [[Wayne G. Hammond]] and [[Christina Scull]], ''[[The Lord of the Rings: A Reader's Companion]]'', p. 579</ref>

Like "[[Gamling]]", it was specifically chosen to suit the character of the old nurse.<ref name=Joukes/>
[[File:The Lord of the Rings Online - Ioreth.jpg|thumb|left|150px|Ioreth in ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'']]
==Portrayal in adaptations==

'''1956: ''[[The Lord of the Rings (1956 radio series)]]'':'''
:[[Prunella Scales]] is credited as Ioreth in the fifth episode of the second run, "Minas Tirith and Mount Doom".<ref name="RT1727">Radio Times, Volume 133, No. 1727, [[14 December|December 14]], [[1956]]</ref> As Scales was in her twenties at the time, it is unknown to what extent the "old lady" aspect was used.

'''1979: [[The Lord of the Rings (1979 radio series)|''The Lord of the Rings'' (1979 radio series)]]:'''
:[[Pat Franklyn]] is credited as "The Old Woman". She is not referred to as Ioreth at any time, but her lines are lifted from Ioreth's.<ref>[[The Lord of the Rings (1979 radio series)|''The Lord of the Rings'' (1979 radio series)]], "The Sword That Was Broken... New Forged"</ref>

'''1981: [[The Lord of the Rings (1981 radio series)|''The Lord of the Rings'' (1981 radio series)]]:'''
:[[Pauline Letts]] plays Ioreth.<ref>[[The Lord of the Rings (1981 radio series)|''The Lord of the Rings'' (1981 radio series)]], "The Battle of Pelennor Fields"</ref> in the absence of [[Bergil]] she is the one who provides Aragorn with the leaves he uses in his ministrations.

'''2003: [[Pán prsteňov (2001-2003 Slovak radio series)|''Pán prsteňov'' (2001-2003 Slovak radio series)]]:'''
:The voice of Ioreth is provided by Vilma Jamnická.

'''2015'': ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'':'''
:Ioreth is found in the Houses of Healing after the battle, where she asks the player to assist her with mixing herbs and delivering medicine to the wounded.<ref>https://lotro-wiki.com/index.php/Ioreth</ref>

:She also found in the High Hall of the Houses of Healing during the [[Midsummer]] Festivals, where she asks you to scare off the noisy revellers and the dispose of the empty bottles.<ref>https://lotro-wiki.com/index.php/Quest:A_Cure_for_all_Ills</ref>
